talk.author: did:plc:73arohju6ylr655svmkfden3
talk.utter: They say that there are about 3 parking spaces for every car in America. Such a sad use of land!

talk.author: did:plc:vk5ub6lpjfhm6uljrtro55wd
talk.utter: You're going to have to explain that.

talk.author: did:plc:73arohju6ylr655svmkfden3
talk.utter: There’s a book called “The High Cost of Free Parking” that is extremely wonk-ish - it reads like a graduate thesis paper. But that’s the thrust of it - having all these places to park our cars is costing us big time in other ways: public transport, dense dev, etc.

talk.author: did:plc:73arohju6ylr655svmkfden3
talk.utter: There’s a book called “The High Cost of Free Parking” that is extremely wonk-ish - it reads like a graduate thesis paper. But that’s the thrust of it - having all these places to park our cars is costing us big time in other ways: public transport, dense dev, etc.

talk.author: did:plc:73arohju6ylr655svmkfden3
talk.utter: Yes, but in the land use average, you have 3 spaces per car.
